story.kicker_image_caption: The company, which announced temporary suspension of production and subsequent partial resumption from Wednesday, said production of cars, to the extent of component availability, is continuing at the Gurgaon plant.
story.storykicker: MSI has advanced the regular bi-annual maintenance closure of its plants to June 6 to June 11 which was earlier scheduled from June 27 to July 2.
story.storybody:
Maruti Suzuki India limited (MSIL) has advanced its bi-annual maintenance closures of plants by three weeks in the wake of component supply disruption due to fire at Manesar plant of its vendor, Subros Ltd.

MSI has, with the cooperation of all employees, advanced the regular bi-annual maintenance closure of its plants to June 6 to June 11 which was earlier scheduled from June 27 to July 2, the company said in a statement.

ALSO READ: Maruti Suzuki's Manesar and Gurgaon plants shut temporarily

"This will enable the closure period to be utilized for arranging supply of components, both from Subros Ltd as well as from other sources, and result in higher production volumes after the closure," it added.

The company, which on Monday announced temporary suspension of production and subsequent partial resumption from Wednesday, said production of cars, to the extent of component availability, is continuing at the Gurgaon plant.

ALSO READ: Maruti Suzuki to resume production at Gurgaon from today

MSI had also restarted certain operations in the Manesar campus, including casting and manufacture of transmissions.

On an average Maruti produces around 5,000 units a day from its two plants at Gurgaon and Manesar, which together have an annually capacity of rolling out 15 lakh units.

ALSO READ: Will supply to Maruti Suzuki from Noida facilities, says Subros chairman

Subros, which is the country's largest auto air conditioning manufacturing firm, has an overall capacity to manufacture up to 10 lakh AC systems per annum.
